## do something simple
```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(30, mean = 5, sd = 3)

(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)
```

I want a function to compute z-scores
```{r}
z_scores = function(x) {
  if(!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("input must be numeric")
  }
  
  if(length(x) < 3){
    stop("input must have at least three numbers")
  }
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)
  
}

z_scores(x_vec)
```
Try my function on some other things, these should give errors
```{r, error=TRUE}
z_scores(3)
z_scores("my name is jeff") # can't take the mean of a character
z_scores(mtcars) # can't take the mean of a dataset
z_scores(c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE))
```

## multiple outputs

```{r}
mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  if(!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("input must be numeric")
  }
  
  if(length(x) < 3){
    stop("input must have at least three numbers")
  }
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  tibble(   #make this a dataframe
    mean = mean_x,
    sd = sd_x
  )

}

```

check that the function works
```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(100, mean = 3, sd = 4)
mean_and_sd(x_vec)
```

## multiple inputs
```{r}
#create a dataframe
sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x=rnorm(n=100, mean = 4, sd = 3)
  )

# compute mean, sd
sim_data %>%
  summarize(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd= sd(x)
  )
```

```{r}
sim_mean_sd = function(sample_size, mu=3, sigma=4) {
  
  sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x=rnorm(n=sample_size, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
  )

# compute mean, sd
  sim_data %>%
    summarize(
      mean = mean(x),
      sd= sd(x)
    )
  
}

sim_mean_sd(100, 6, 3) #100 is sample size

```
